content:
The Programming Languages Lab, Huawei Research Centre, Edinburgh, UK is currently advertising a full-time Programming Languages Researcher/Senior Researcher position. We are looking especially for someone with RUST experience at the level of theory, compilation, or verification. PHD (recent or imminent) and a research track record are essential.

Huawei is a founding member of the recently formed RUST foundation.

For further information please email me (dan.ghica@huawei.com) or visit this site: https://blogs.ed.ac.uk/he-lab/2021/04/22/hiring-programming-languages-researcher-senior-researcher/

Best wishes,
Dan
I hope it's ok I advertised here. If not blame @Alan Jeffrey who told me to :)

There's also a Reddit hiring thread where you might want to post (it used to be weekly, but that might have changed): https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/mfstaz/official_rrust_whos_hiring_thread_for_jobseekers/ and you'll find a bit more good will if you write Rust like that instead of RUST, which seems to be preferred when talking about the game with the same name. Posting on Zulip is less usual, but it might not be a bad idea, since people working on the compiler are here and they might have a formal education in the field.
Yes, I am not looking for a Rust programmer. Apologies for the RUST spelling. You can see how much I personally know about it.
No worries, it's just one of the little things that some people will judge you upon
